description.narrative: Better functioning of the unions education department makes it possible to organize a wider spectrum of different level trainings and follow-up and support of trained activists and elected officials / shop stewards. MANWU prepares for the 2016 Congress by developing a new strategy plan and improving organizational sustainability: updating and harmonizing the membership register and the financial management systems, as well as administration training at the same time with continuous recruitment of members ar e parts of this. Communication skills are improved and a network of voluntary activists set up.##The membership growth brought along a positive problem: member services and activating of members have not been able to follow the pace of growth. Systematic e ducation work is expected to improve the knowhow of union officials, shop stewards and activists and thereby improve the benefits of membership for rank and file members. #As a result of the project the union has sufficient number of adequately skilled peo ple to take care of basic level unionism and interest representation training. A network of volunteers has been established and functions around the country. The 2016-2019 strategy plan has been developed, approved at the 2016 Congress and put into use. Th e website and facebook are regularly updated by an office employee who has been trained for this task, and the shop stewards manual has been translated into Oshiwambo and Herero. The membership register and the financial management system have been updated and harmonized. 10 000 new members have been recruited by the end of 2017.##Beneficiaries of the project are members and activists of MANWU through improved member services and knowhow.##Metal and Allied Namibian Workers Union MANWU has as its largest sec tors metal and motor industries and construction. The membership of the union in around 15 000 and there is a total potential of about 40 000.
